snippet: The trade gap shrank more than 19 percent, the biggest drop since 2009, one of a series of economic reports that suggested a rebound by the economy.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports drop in United States trade deficit to $40.9 billion from March's revised deficit of $50.6 billion; ADP reports private employers hired 201,000 new workers in May, most since January.
lead_paragraph: The trade gap shrank more than 19 percent, the biggest drop since 2009, one of a series of economic reports that suggested a rebound by the economy.

headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Trims, and Hiring Is Up
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Trims, and Hiring Is Up
